title: PHOTOS: $2.9 million for Gwinnett mansion on 18th hole at Sugarloaf
text:
After a long day on the golf course at TPC Sugarloaf, you won’t have a long trip home, at least if you have the$2.9 million for this Duluth mansion.
The more than 11,000-square-foot home sits on 1.15 acres on a tidy cul-de-sac and at the edge of the 18th hole of TPC Sugarloaf, inside the Sugarloaf Country Club. The luxurious interior includes intricately carved wood paneling, eight bedroom suites and a detached apartment over a three-car garage.
A dramatic staircase and marble floors welcome guests into the palatial home, and cathedral ceilings with long windows let sun stream into the living quarters. There are kitchens inside and outside, so you can cook dinner overlooking the golf course or surrounded by family in the nearby sitting room.
There’s also a commercial-grade wine cellar, with a wet bar and pool table nearby for entertaining. Use the steam shower to relax and clean up after working out in the fitness center, or cool off in the lagoon-like pool out back. A little chilly for a swim? Don’t worry, the pool is heated.
The home is represented by Mary Floyd of Berkshire Hathaway HomeServices Georgia Properties.
